Package main.java.model

Interface DataIO

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataIOImpl
    public interface DataIO
    This interface provides all the data input and output functionality to the Model. It has functions like readPersistedPortfolios, readPriceCache, savingPortfolio etc.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.List<Stock> readMasterStockList()
      This method reads all the stocks that are supported by the application.
      java.util.List<Portfolio> readPersistedPortfolios()
      This method reads all the portfolios that are persisted in the application.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> readUserGivenFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
      This method processes the file given by the user and returns it to the model.
      void savePortfolios​(java.util.List<Portfolio> portfolios)
      This method allows the to save the portfolio in a json file.

    • Method Detail

      • readPersistedPortfolios

        java.util.List<Portfolio> readPersistedPortfolios()
        This method reads all the portfolios that are persisted in the application.
        Returns:
        List of Portfolio objects that are persisted in the application.

      • readMasterStockList

        java.util.List<Stock> readMasterStockList()
        This method reads all the stocks that are supported by the application.
        Returns:
        List of Stock objects that were read from the master config file.

      • readUserGivenFile

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> readUserGivenFile​(java.lang.String filePath)
                                            throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        This method processes the file given by the user and returns it to the model.
        Parameters:
        filePath - filePath of the file that needs to processed.
        Returns:
        List of string each representing a row in the user provided file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - 1.If File not found in the given path. 2.File is empty.

      • savePortfolios

        void savePortfolios​(java.util.List<Portfolio> portfolios)
             throws java.io.IOException
        This method allows the to save the portfolio in a json file.
        Parameters:
        portfolios - The portfolio that needs be saved
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - 1. The file writer fails
